::Slayer::

Slayer nods, memorizing the plan and studying the map. "Allright. I'm 
ready to go. You all set?"




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Slayer growls at the mention of Lunarpine. "If I see him again, 
I'll
> > tear his circuitry out through his audio receptors."
> 
> Ignatius pauses for a moment hoping that Slayer can contain himself. 
"First
> things first, Prebons our first priority."
> 
> > Slayer  turns, looking at a map of earth. "Allright, so where will 
you be
> > waiting?"
> 
> Ignatius acrivates his recon map and crossreferences it to the main
> computer. The computer zooms in on an area leading through the 
mountains.
> "I'll set up mirror sensors along this valley. When you lead the 
Maximals
> through the canyon I'll cause an avalanche to cut off thier escape. 
The
> mirror sensors will give false readings so they won't know where I 
am or how
> many bot's I have with me. I'll pin them down from above, and you 
hit them
> from the front. With thier backs to the wall they'll be sitting 
ducks."
> 
> Ignatius sits down and puts his feet up on the console. He leaned 
back
> rather proud of his plan. He wasn't a scientist but when it came to 
logic he
> was an ace.
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <Yanshosh@a...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Wednesday, March 14, 2001 10:13 AM
> Subject: Re: Battles and Shuttles: Outside base
>

I'll

> >

you be
> > waiting?"

enough
> > attention
> > > just flying into scanner range but in case he was wrong he'd 
need
> > more
> > > influence. "Fire off a few missles at the shield and use your 
lasers
> > on
> > > anything moving outside the base. If that doesn't get thier
> > attention then
> > > they're either dead or deaf." Another factor came to mind. "Oh, 
if
> > you see
> > > the bot you fought last time avoid him I don't want to have to 
pick
> > up your
> > > pieces
> >
